title: pwd
body: Print the name of the current directory.

title: dir
body: List the contents of the current directory.

title: c:
body: Change the current directory to the root of the 'c:' hard drive.

title: cd
body:
cd <path>

Change the current directory. The path can be absolute or relative (e.g. if your current path is 'c:' and you want to change it to 'c:\system' you can type 'cd c:\system' or just 'cd system').

cd ..

Move the current directory one level up the directory tree.

title: login
body:
login <user> <password>

Log as a different user, where 'user' is either 'root' or 'guest' and 'password' is the password corresponding to that account.

The default passwords for the root and guest accounts are 'root' and 'guest' respectively.

title: mail
body: Open the logged user's email reader.

title: a:
body: Change the current directory to the root of the 'a:' disk drive.

title: netmap
body:
Print a list of IPs for all the devices sharing the same network as yours.

NOTE: Depending of the version of netmap and their security settings some devices may be hidden from the list.

title: read
body:
read <path>

Display the contents of the text file in the path provided. The file extension (usually .txt but other extensions are sometimes used) must be included in the path.

title: telnet
body:
telnet <ip>

Establish a telnet connection to the machine with the provided ip.

telnet <ip> <port>

Same as above but specifying the port number (23 by default).
